benchmark_details.name: STR-2022 (Semantic Textual Relatedness 2022)
benchmark_details.overview: The first manually annotated dataset of sentence-sentence semantic relatedness with 5,500 English sentence pairs and fine-grained relatedness scores from 0 to 1.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset for exploring the semantic relatedness of sentence pairs and to evaluate automatic methods of sentence representation.

data.source: Curated from various sources including Goodreads, Wikipedia, SNLI, among others.
data.annotation: Manually annotated using a comparative annotation framework.

methods: Crowdsourced annotation via Amazon Mechanical Turk
methodology.calculation: Spearman correlation between predicted and gold relatedness scores.
methodology.interpretation: A higher score indicates greater semantic relatedness between two sentences.
methodology.validation: Validation was performed using a reliable annotation process with repeat annotations.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset may include more sentences from people with certain socio-economic and educational backgrounds.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: No identifiable information was collected from annotators, and sentences were selected to pose no privacy risk.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: The crowd-sourced task was approved by the Institutional Research Ethics Board.
